Description: Floor and foot sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery bowl; convex ring foot with central nipple and scraped groove on resting surface; glazed black on interior, exterior (foot) and underside; reserved: junction of wall and foot, groove in resting surface (?); resting surface worn or reserved; impressed decoration on interior consisting three (originally five) linked palmettes around small central circle surrounded by circle of short rouletting.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Piekarski compares this fragment to bowls with incurving rim (Sparkes, Agora XII nos. 830-833 figs. 8 and 22, pl. 33), dated 350BC - 325BC. see also Rotroff, Agora XXIX no. 969 pls. 75. and 146 (P19360), dated around 300BC.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 47 no. D 8 pl. 19.4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (ID.033)
